PyStar: Programming Workshops for Women and Their Friends

next

Welcome to PyStar!¶

The PyStar program is workshop designed to teach all women (including trans women) and their friends who are looking to learn how to program in a friendly non-alpha geek environment. The material on this site builds on Boston Python Workshop which was held March 4/5, 2011.

If you would like to do a PyStar workshop in your area using this material, please get in touch by emailing the OpenHatch events list: events@lists.openhatch.org.

PyStar Minneapolis¶

The Minneapolis PyStar is March 25th (6 - 8pm) and 26th (9am - 4pm) 2011 at Clockwork Active Media Systems:

1501 East Hennepin Avenue Minneapolis, MN 55414

Register here: http://pystar-mpls-1.eventbrite.com/

PyStar SanFrancisco¶

Dates: Friday April 29th (6 - 8pm) and Saturday April 30th (9am - 4pm) at the Mozilla office in Mountain View

650 Castro St, Suite 300 Mountain View, CA 94043

Please check back for event registration link

PyStar Boston¶

Boston had the first workshop on March 4 & 5, 2011. See their wiki for more information on the course they gave.

Stay tuned for future workshops.
